name: Subaquatic Lounge 02 (Great Barrier Reef Institute of Marine Toxicology), The Offshore Firm (2021)
description:
"Subaquatic Lounge 02 (Great Barrier Reef Institute of Marine Toxicology)"
The Offshore Firm (2021)
1260 x 900 px, GIF

///////// In order to keep the Postdocs from revolting, the Subaquatic Lounge was made available to them on Sundays. So every week they would pour in with cheerful abandon, scoping the complementary bottle of wine and looking for snacks. One of them turns to the vending machine. A single can of Coke costs 45 dollars. "Restocking the machine is really expensive, because we're underwater," mutters a Postdoc with resignation, "but don't worry, we got a guy who can sometimes jimmy the locks." /////////

Metarealistic game photography depicting hypercorporate, antisocial, and sometimes liminal virtual environments.

This photographed scene was created using "The Life Stage: Virtual House," a building design simulator released in 1993 for the 3DO console.

Although the game has fallen into obscurity, it was notably ahead of its time for its use of photographic gameplay elements within an immersive 3D virtual space.

// Artwork by Sabato Visconti // www.sabatobox.com // @sabatobox on IG //
